bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Wilfred W.G. Beveridge, November 16, 1928

div1.p: Kean sends a reprint of his speech, given at the dedication of Walter Reed's birthplace, to Beveridge.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Wilfred W.G. Beveridge, November 16, 1928
div1.opener:
II
16 November, 1928.
Sir Wilfred Beveridge,
London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine,
37 Torrington Square, London.
My dear Sir William:
div1.p:
I am pleased and honored to comply with
your request to send a reprint of my address on the
dedication of the birth place of Walter Reed published
in the Military Surgeon of March 1928. It has been
sent under separate enclosure.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, J. R. KEAN,
Colonel, U.S. Army, Retd.
Editor JRK/F
